intro: Dysoxylum myriandrum, commonly known as the many-flowered dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
